purpose: Define the rules and guarantees that preserve the reliability, safety, and continuity of the WyneOS ecosystem across all operational states.

principles.integrityFirst: No operation can run unless seals and manifests are verified.
principles.governanceAligned: All actions must pass through approved governance routes.
principles.auditContinuous: Every significant event must have an audit entry.
principles.stableExecution: Modules must run within defined resource and timing limits.
principles.recoveryReady: Failures must trigger fallback or recovery procedures.

sealVerification.description: Validate all phase seals and system identity before execution.

manifestChecks.description: Validate manifests for Phase 1 to Phase 9 before allowing the engines to run.

telemetryRequirements.description: Telemetry must be available, current, and valid for all decision pathways.

runtimeRestrictions.description: No script or engine may execute if the system is in controlled mode or if an integrity breach is detected.

auditPolicy.description: All decisions, failures, and fallback actions must be written to system audit.

summary.statement: This contract defines the operational safety boundaries of WyneOS. No engine, module, or runtime may act outside these constraints.
